p: Various research institutes, academia, and government organizations are working on collaborative projects such as the projects “Impacts of Climate Change on Pakistan’s Water Sector Vulnerability Assessment” and “Glacial Lakes Outburst Floods” (funded by the United Nations Development Program). Other climate and water conservation projects are conducted by different government institutions such as the Climate Change, Alternative Energy, and Water Resources Department of Pakistan; Agriculture Research Center and Global Change Impact Study Center; as well as international non-governmental organizations. There are many other organizations both at government level and in the private sector working on impacts of climate change, natural disasters, and their direct impacts human health. Private and government authorities are also working on water quality and other water related issues.
